gov.usgs.anss.gui

Class SpansList

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.gui.SpansList
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GapsList, HoldingsList

    public class SpansList
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a list of abstract time intervals called Spans. The type of elements of this list is SpansList.Span. This is the common superclass of HoldingsList and GapsList.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SpansList.Span
      A Span represents an interval of time with millisecond precision.

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • getSpansListSize

        public int getSpansListSize()

      • add

        public void add(long start,
       long end)
        Add a span to the end of the list. Do not do anything if span length is zero or negative
        Parameters:
        start - A milliseconds time since 1970
        end - A Milliseconds time since 1970

      • add

        public void add(SpansList.Span span)
        Add a Span to the end of the list. Don't do anything if the length of the span is zero or negative.
        Parameters:
        span - The Span to add

      • get

        public SpansList.Span get(int index)
        Retrieve a Span from the list by index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the Span to retrieve
        Returns:
        The span at index i
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the number of Spans in the list.
        Returns:
        the number of Spans in the list.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Empty the list.

      • getSpansLength

        public long getSpansLength()
        Return the total length of the spans in this SpansList.
        Returns:
        the sum of the lengths of the spans, in milliseconds

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Sort the list into ascending order by the start dates of the spans.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any Span's start field is null.

      • consolidate

        public void consolidate()
        Consolidate this SpansList in place. Overlapping Spans are merged together and the list is trimmed to the new size if necessary.

      • endpointsIterator

        public java.util.Iterator endpointsIterator()
        Return an Iterator over the endpoints of the Spans in the list. One Span's start and end are returned in order before moving to the next.
        Returns:
        An iterator

      • write

        public void write(java.io.Writer writer)
        Write this list to writer. One Span is written per line, in the form "start\tend", where '\t' represents a tab character.
        Parameters:
        writer - where to write the report
